Package model

Class ControllerMain

java.lang.Object
model.ControllerMain
public class ControllerMain extends Object
The ControllerMain class is responsible for managing the game and interacting with the user.

  • Method Details

    • initGame

      public String initGame(String namePlayer)
      The function initializes a new game and returns the result of the game's initialization with the given player name.
      Parameters:
      namePlayer - A String representing the name of the player.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the result of the `game.initGame(namePlayer)` method call.

    • putPipe

      public String putPipe(String pipe, int x, int y)
      The function takes a pipe character and coordinates as input, checks for validity, and returns a message indicating whether the pipe was successfully placed or not.
      Parameters:
      pipe - The parameter "pipe" is a string that represents the type of pipe to be placed. It can have the following values: "||", "=", "o", or "x".
      x - The x parameter represents the x-coordinate of the position where the pipe will be placed.
      y - The parameter "y" represents the y-coordinate of the position where the pipe is to be placed.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String.

    • evaluatePipe

      public String evaluatePipe()
      The function "evaluatePipe" returns the result of evaluating the game's pipe.
      Returns:
      The method evaluatePipe() is being called on the object "game" and the result of that method is being returned.

    • finishMatch

      public String finishMatch()
      The function "finishMatch" returns a string indicating whether the game's pipe system is working or not.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String.

    • getCurrentBoardState

      public String getCurrentBoardState()

    • getRanking

      public String getRanking()
      The function returns the ranking of players, or a message indicating that there are no registered players.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string. If the playersBST is empty, it returns the message "No hay jugadores registrados." Otherwise, it returns the ranking of the players, with the number 4 indicating the top 4 players in the ranking.
